isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - IC BUS - ELECTRONIC ENGINES, DT 466E AND T 444E - TROUBLESHOOTING

svcprocinfo.para: Before beginning these test procedures, do the following:

item.para: Make sure the vehicle batteries are at 75% state of charge (SOC) or higher. This represents an open circuit voltage (OCV) of 12.4 volts. Batteries with an OCV of 12 volts or less are either completely discharged or have a dead cell.
Check any light or indicator lamp filaments that are suspected of being open (burned out). This is done to avoid unnecessary extensive circuit checks.
Inspect all connectors for loose or damaged pins, wires, etc. Refer to TEST EQUIPMENT AND CONNECTOR REPAIR section in GROUP 08 - ELECTRICAL in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

When the technician determines that a fuse is blown, while checking its condition, he is directed to locate the cause of the overload condition and to repair it. While no further instruction on this procedure is listed in the diagnostic tables, the common procedure is as follows: isolate sections of the circuit by disconnecting connectors, and measure the resistance to ground to find the circuit that is shorted to ground. Then locate the damaged spot in the wire or connector and repair.

Diagnostics for circuits that are malfunctioning by sticking in the ON position are generally not covered in detail. It is assumed that the technician knows to check for a malfunctioning switch, relay, or solenoid.

svcsubproc.title: ECM Power and Ground System Circuitry

table.title: ECM Power and Ground System Circuitry

entry.para: Disconnect black ECM conn. (379). Turn key ON and at cavity 24, measure voltage from circuit 97CR to ground.
Remove fuse F17 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At F17 fuse cavity A, check voltage from circuit 13 to ground. Re-install fuse.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 13, then repair.
Disconnect bulkhead conn. (3). Turn key ON and at cavity V, measure voltage from circuit 97CR to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 97CR, then repair.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 97CR between (3) and ECM Conn. (379). Reconnect connectors.
If condition persists, go to next step.
Remove ECM power relay (396). At socket cavity 30, measure voltage from circuit 14B to ground.
Remove 40A power module in-line fuse holder from between circuits 14A and 14B, and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse holder, measure voltage from circuit 14A to ground. Re-install fuse.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14A, then repair.
Disconnect positive battery conn. (412) and at circuit 14B, check voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14B, then repair.
Reconnect (412) and disconnect battery/ engine harness conn. (426). At circuit 14B, check voltage to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14B, then repair.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14B between (426) and ECM power relay (396), then repair. Reconnect connectors.
If condition persists, go to next step.
At relay (396) socket cavity 85, measure voltage from circuit 97CT to ground.
Remove fuse F9 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At F9 fuse cavity A, measure voltage from circuit 97CT to ground. Re-install fuse.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 97CT, then repair.
At diagnostic and program dash connector (419), cavity C, measure voltage from circuit 97C to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 97C, then repair.
Disconnect bulkhead conn. (3). Turn key ON and at cavity U, measure voltage from circuit 97CT to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 97CT, then repair.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 97CT between (3) and ECM power relay (396), then repair. Reconnect connectors.
If condition persists, go to next step.
Bench test ECM power relay (396) by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Bench test relay (396) by applying +12V to pin 85 and ground to pin 86, and measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87.
Measure resistance of circuit 97AH between relay (396), socket cavity 86, and ECM conn. (379), cavity 25.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 97AH, then repair.
Measure resistance of circuits between relay (396), socket cavity 87, and ECM conn. (379), cavities 21, 22, and 41.
Locate open or poor connection in circuits 97CM, splice, 97CL, 97CK, or 97AL, then repair.
At ECM conn. (379), measure resistance of circuits at cavities 1, 2, 23, and 42 to ground.
Disconnect battery harness conn. (426). At cavity B, measure resistance of circuit 11-G to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 11-G or negative battery conn. (665), then repair.
Locate open or poor connection in circuits 11-G, splice, 11-GX, 11-GW, 11-GY, 11-GZ, then repair. Go to next step.

Reconnect connectors. Power module and ground system circuits check good. Should condition persist, refer to Engine Diagnostics Manual for troubleshooting the Electronic Control Module before replacing.

svcsubproc.title: Accelerator (APS/IVS), Barometric Air Pressure (BAP), and Ambient Air Temperature Sensor (ATS) Systems

table.title: Accelerator (APS/IVS), Barometric Air Pressure (BAP), and Ambient Air Temperature Sensor (ATS) Systems

entry.para: Is a fault code present for APS/IVS sensor/switch?
Remove and check fuse F18 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse F18, measure voltage from cavity A, circuit 13 to ground. Re-install fuse.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 13, then repair.
Disconnect APS/IVS conn. (382) and at cavity F, measure voltage from circuit 99E to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 99E, then repair.
At (382), install jumper from cavity A, circuit 99B to gnd. Disconnect ECM conn. (379). At cavity 8, measure resistance from circuit 99B to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 99B or bulkhead conn. (3), then repair.
At (382), move jumper to cavity B, circuit 99A and ground. At (379) cavity 11, measure resistance of circuit 97WB to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 97WB, splice, 97W, bulkhead conn. (3), or circuit 97W, splice, 99A, then repair.
At (382), move jumper to cavity C, circuit 99C(5V) and ground. At (379) cavity 3, measure resistance of circuit 97U(5V) to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 97U(5V), bulkhead conn. (3), or circuit 97U(5V), splice, 99C(5V), then repair.
At (382), move jumper to cavity D, circuit 99D and ground. At (379) cavity 27, measure resistance of circuit 99D to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 99D, or bulkhead conn. (3), then repair.
Remove jumper and reconnect connectors. APS/IVS circuits check good. Is problem corrected?
Replace APS/IVS. If problem persists, refer to Engine Diagnostic Manuals.
Is a fault code present for BAP sensor?
Disconnect BAP sensor connector (406). Install jumper wire from cavity 1, circuit 97Z to ground. Disconnect ECM conn. (379). At cavity 11, measure resistance of circuit 97WB to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 97Z, splice, 97W, bulkhead conn. (3), or circuit 97W, splice, 97WB, then repair.
At (406), move jumper wire to cavity 2, circuit 97BL(5V) and ground. At (379) cavity 3, measure resistance of circuit 97U(5V) to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 97U(5V), bulkhead conn. (3), or circuit 97U(5V), splice, 97BL(5V), then repair.
At (406), move jumper wire to cavity 3, circuit 97CD and ground. At (379) cavity 29, measure resistance of circuit 97CD to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 97CD or bulkhead conn. (3), then repair.
Remove jumper and reconnect connectors. BAP system circuits check good. Is problem corrected?
Replace BAP sensor. If problem persists, refer to Engine Diagnostic Manuals.
Is a fault code present for the ATS system?
Disconnect ATS conn. (463). Install jumper wire from cavity B, circuit 97AX to ground. Disconnect ECM conn. (379). At cavity 12, measure resistance from circuit 97AX to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 97AX, then repair.
At (463), move jumper to cavity A, circuit 97BU and ground. At (379) cavity 11, measure resistance of circuit 97WB to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 97WB, splice, 97BU, then repair.
Remove jumper and reconnect connectors. ATS system circuits check good. Is problem corrected?
Replace ATS. If problem persists, refer to Engine Diagnostic Manuals.
Check fuse F24 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
Re-install fuse F24, move key switch to ignition position, and at fuse F24 and circuit 13, 13C measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 13, 13C, then repair.
At fuse F24 and circuit 28/97B, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 28/97B, then repair.
Check fuse F3 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At F3 and circuit 14AA, 14A, measure voltage to ground. Re-install fuse.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14AA, 14A, then repair.
At F3 and circuit 97DK, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 97DK, then repair.
At brake/cruise interface relay (R6), and at circuit 97DJ, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 97DJ, then repair.
Remove relay (R6), measure resistance at relay socket (R6) circuit 97-GA, and 11-GB to bus cab ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 97-GA, 11-GB, then repair.
At relay (R6), place cruise/throttle ON/OFF switch (391) OFF, and at relay socket (R6) circuit 97DJ, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 97DJ, then repair.
Bench test relay (R6) by measuring resistance from terminal 30 to 87A.
Bench relay (R6) by applying +12 V to pin 85, ground to pin 86, and measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87.
Re-install relay (R6), and circuit 97DJ, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 97DJ, then repair.
Disconnect dash conn. (2). Turn key and cruise switch (391) ON. At (2), measure voltage from cir. 97CF cavity 24 to gnd.
Disconnect cruise ON/OFF sw. (391) and with switch in ON position, measure resistance across term.
At conn. (391), measure voltage from circuit 97DJ to ground. Reconnect connectors.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 97DJ, then repair.
At conn. (2), measure resistance of circuit 97CF cavity 24 to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 97CF, then repair.
At conn. (2), measure voltage from circuit 97DH cavity 25 to ground with set/resume switch (392) held in the set position.
Disconnect cruise set/ resume switch (392). With sw. held in set position (term. 2 to 3) and then in resume position (term. 2 to 1), measure resistance across terminals in each position.
(392) across sw. terminals 2 to 3 and 2 to 1.
At conn. (392), measure voltage from circuit 97CA to ground. Reconnect connectors.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 97CA, then repair.
At conn. (2), measure resistance of circuit 97DH cavity 25 to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 97DH, then repair.
At conn. (2), measure voltage from circuit 97DE cavity 26 to ground with set/resume switch (392) held in the resume position.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 97DE, then repair.
At conn. (2), measure resistance of circuit 97DE cavity 26 to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 97DE, then repair.
Reconnect connectors. Cruise control circuitry checks good. If condition persists, refer to Engine Diagnostic Manuals for ECM diagnostics. Go to next step.
If vehicle is equipped with Body Builder PTO controls, refer to Miscellaneous Information in CT-471 Body Builder Book.

para.emph: Before troubleshooting circuitry, verify air or hydraulic pressure is available at the shutter solenoid.

entry.para: Check fuse F15 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
Re-install fuse F15, move key switch to ignition position, and at fuse F15 and circuit 13H, conn. (3), 13H measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 13H, conn. (3), 13H then repair.
Disconnect fan/shutter/ac conn. (337). Turn key ON and at engine harness, measure voltage from circuit 23, 23A, 97ACD, ECM (379) to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuit 23, 23A, 97ACD, ECM (379), conn. (3), then repair.
Reconnect conn. (337). Do the shutters open and close?
Disconnect eng fan & shutter solenoid conn. (336). Turn key ON and at shutter harness, measure voltage from circuit 97ESS to ground.
Refer to Engine Diagnostic Manual for troubleshooting ECM.
At conn. (336), install jumper from 97ESS to ground. Disconnect shutter solenoid conn. (340) and turn key ON. At (340), measure voltage from circuit 23B to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuit 23, 23A, 23B, then repair.
At conn. (340), measure voltage from circuit 23B to 97ESS.
Locate open in circuit 97ESS, control module (1205), then repair.
Remove jumper and reconnect connectors. Shutter circuitry checks good. If condition persists, refer to Engine Diagnostic Manual for troubleshooting ECM.
Does the fan turn ON and OFF?
Remove fan clutch relay (339), and at relay socket (339) circuit 23C, measure voltage to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 23C, then repair.
At relay socket (339) circuit 23D, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 23D, then repair.
Disconnect conn. (336). At relay socket (339) circuit 97EFS, measure resistance to conn. (336).
Locate cause of open in circuit 97EFS, conn. (336), then repair.
Bench test fan clutch relay (339) by measuring resistance from terminal 30 to 87A.
Bench test relay (339) by applying +12 V to pin 86, ground to pin 85, and measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87.
Remove fan clutch solenoid conn. (335), at relay socket (339), measure resistance of circuit 23E to conn. (335).
Locate open in circuit 23E, conn. (335), then repair.
Re-install relay (339), at conn. (335) measure resistance of circuit 23-G to ground.
Locate open in circuit 23-G, then repair.
At fan clutch solenoid conn. (335), measure resistance from terminal A to B.
At fan clutch solenoid conn. (335), measure resistance from terminal B to A.
Turn key ON. At conn. (335), measure voltage from circuit 23E to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage condition in relay (339), circuit 23E, 23-G, then repair.
At conn. (336), install jumper from 97EFS to ground. Turn key ON. At conn. (335), measure voltage from circuit 23E to ground.
Locate cause of open in circuit 97EFS, control module (1205), then repair.
Remove jumper and reconnect connectors. fan circuitry checks good. If condition persists, refer to Engine Diagnostic Manual for troubleshooting ECM.
